page.title: 07LEVEN CANAL
page.content: Our village has an unusual feature we have a private canal. The canal was built and opened in 1802, it was promoted by Mrs Charlotta Bethell of Rise, who was a very important landowner.(The Bethell family are still Lords of the manor of Leven).The canal runs in nearly a straight line from the river Hull, where there is a disused lock, for three & a quarter miles to its head.The canal was built to improve trade links between Hull & Leven, Humber Keel boats,up to 85 tons were able to use it, bringing cargoes such as coal, lime & manure from Hull & carrying corn & bricks away. Today the canal has no boats on it, people come to stay at a small caravan site. Some people like to come to fish there is a Trout farm.Local people use the canal for walks & birdwatching as it is very pretty.
